{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3174477,"name":"acastagna","username":"acastagna","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/a88e4f/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-27T20:00:23.174Z","cooked":"

We are running a swerve drive with Falcons for the drive and turn motors, and have noticed our odometry occasionally jumps from being very accurate to being off by a factor of exactly 2. In telep the pose from odemetry.update would go from reading almost the exact distance to exactly 1/2 of the actual distance.

This throws off our auto path following. When running a path when the odometry is off, the robot tries to match the actual pose to the desired pose and comes close, but the actual distance is scaled.

The robot drives perfectly in teleop, where the pose does not come into play. We combed through our code and are at a loss. My best thought is something with the turn module optimization where the odometry isn’t accounting for a drive motor facing 180 degrees with a negated velocity.

Here’s our somewhat rambling code. Any suggestions would be appreciated.

GitHub

GitHub - Team-1493/CompetitionCode2023

Contribute to Team-1493/CompetitionCode2023 development by creating an account on GitHub.
